column1: USMCA is a renewed commitment between the U.S. Canada & Mexico & I look forward to working with our trade allies to continue advancing a North American economy that creates good-paying jobs and is in line with our values.

Today we cleared another hurdle in getting a trade deal signed into law that ensures a level playing field for WI farmers workers & families keeps jobs in the US & makes this deal enforceable. https://t.co/9JdZqZvXp9

If President Trump wants to escalate our military involvement in countries overseas he must come before Congress present a clear thought-out strategy and make the case to the American people and seek approval.

another Middle Eastern conflict—something no one wants – with no clear long-term strategy.   Once again the President is taking military action without consulting Congress as constitutionally required or without knowing how Iran will retaliate.

This deal is a great example of what can be accomplished when people work across the aisle to get things done and should serve as the template for all future trade agreement negotiations.

John’s wise words stuck with me and I’ve passed his advice along as I mentor new Members here in the House. His wit and wisdom will be missed.
I’ll never forget what John said: You have an important job but you’re not an important person. The minute you think you are is the minute you cut corners.
When I first came to Congress John Dingell was one of the first people I sought out for advice.

Tawni and I are saddened to hear about the passing of former Rep. John Dingell. John challenged all of us to come together to make life better for all Americans. His positive attitude will be missed. Our prayers go to Debbie the Dingell family and our Michigan neighbors tonight.

1/3 We can all agree: America needs unity.
